definition: to see the light again (idiom); delivered from oppression
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan

sentences.english: If you attack the Pentagon, you might want to hide.
sentences.chinese: 如果你袭击了五角大楼，你就别想重见天日。

sentences.english: An immigration amnesty has enabled many illegal residents in the U.
sentences.chinese: 移民大赦使得部分非法在美居留的人得以重见天日。

sentences.english: A long-buried side of early Christianity is re-emerging.
sentences.chinese: 如今早期基督教被掩藏已久的那一面正在重见天日。

sentences.english: So a lot of these things were rediscovered.
sentences.chinese: 这样一大批手稿得以重见天日。

sentences.english: I know inside of you there's a nice girl that's just dying to come out.
sentences.chinese: 我知道你内心的那个好女孩快要重见天日了。

sentences.english: The eyes of the blind shall see the day and the ears of the deaf shall be opened.
sentences.chinese: 盲人之眼必重见天日，聋人之耳必重闻世音。

sentences.english: Museum basements are stacked full of objects which never see the light of day.
sentences.chinese: 博物馆的地下室里堆满了永远不会重见天日的物件。

definition: precious mineral deposits/hidden treasure/(fig.) treasure/(Buddhism) the treasure of Buddha's law
to announce to the world (idiom)/to make public/to let everyone know
the whole truth is revealed (idiom); everything becomes clear
to exonerate/to clear (from an accusation)/to rehabilitate
covered in dust/dusty/lying unused for a long time
underground palace (as part of imperial tomb)
